newsitem.title: USA: Pakistan may seek up to 300,000 T wheat - trade.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan may seek up to 300,000 T wheat - trade.

text.p: Pakistan may seek anywhere from 200,000 to 300,000 tonnes optional origin wheat as early as this weekend with the United States, the most likely supplier, several U.S. exporters said.
"I am hearing this Friday for probably 300,000 tonnes. The wheat will be optional origin," one U.S. exporter said. "I believe the delivery dates will be June/July. I do not have the specifics on it."
A second exporter said Pakistan may be in for 200,000 tonnes and possibly more.
"They want to tender for optional origin with the U.S., more likely the supplier for soft white wheat," he said.
The delivery period was not clarified.
"The shipment could be May or June. Some of it will be taken by the end of May and some of it, the beginning of June," the second exporter said.
A third exporter agreed Pakistan was supposed to tender maybe for 300,000 tonnes. "Nobody knows for sure," he said.
Nothing has been officially announced, exporters said.
A Pakistan embassy spokesman said early Wednesday he had no comment on the tender.
